page.title: 05FARMING AROUND SOUTHWELL (2)
page.content: First the farmer will{plough his field leaving one of the channels. then the seed is sown,that is it is planted into the channels and covered. When is is growing is sprayed with{fertiliser}to help grow and develop. When the crop is ripe,it is harvested. All these jobs are done by machines,operated by the farmer. The ploughing is done by{tractor,}with a huge plough rigged on the back. The sowing is done with a drilling machine, drawn by a tractor, and also a device for scattering the seed. Fertilising the crops and spraying for pests and diseases is done by tractor,and also by{helicopter}or a {light aeroplane,}which the farmer might hire.
